Pillar was an All-American center fielder in college. He set the NCAA Division II record with a 54-game hitting streak in 2010, and established his school's all-time record with a career batting average of .367.

people.name: Iago Falqué
people.aboutText:
Julia Glushko (or Yulia Glushko, Hebrew: יוליה גלושקו; born 4 January 1990) is an Israeli professional tennis player.
Glushko and her family moved to Israel when she was only 9 years old. Since then, she has won eight singles and eight doubles titles on the ITF tour in her career.

people.name: Julia Glushko
people.aboutText: Iago Falque Silva (Spanish pronunciation: [ˈjaɣo ˈfalke]; born 4 January 1990) is a Spanish footballer who plays as a left winger for Italian club Roma.

people.name: Toni Kroos
people.aboutText:
Toni Kroos (German pronunciation: [ˈtoːniː ˈkʁoːs]; born 4 January 1990) is a German professional footballer who plays as a midfielder for Spanish club Real Madrid and the German national team.
A member of Bayern Munich's first team at the age of 17, Kroos became a regular after an 18-month loan spell at Bayer Leverkusen, and won honours including three Bundesliga titles and the 2013 Champions League. After winning the World Cup in 2014, he joined Real Madrid on a six-year contract.

people.name: Alberto Paloschi
people.aboutText: Alberto Paloschi (Italian pronunciation: [alˈbɛrto paˈloski]; born 4 January 1990 in Chiari, Brescia) is an Italian footballer who plays as a striker for Serie A club Chievo.

people.name: Tal al-Mallohi
people.aboutText: Tal Dosr al-Mallohi (alternately, al-Mallouhi) (Arabic: طل الملوحي‎) born in Homs January 4, 1991 is a Syrian blogger from Homs. She has been called "the youngest prisoner of conscience in the Arab world". On 27 December 2009, Tal was taken from her home by officers of one of the security offices in Syria because she has written poems about Palestine and social commentaries on her blog.

people.name: Stefan Nenadović
people.aboutText: Stefan Nenadović (born 4 January 1991) is a Montenegrin footballer who plays for Montenegrin First League club OFK Bar.

people.name: Mikk Pinnonen
people.aboutText: Olivia Tennet (born 4 January 1991) is a New Zealand actress and dancer best known in her home country for her role as Tuesday Warner on the nightly medical drama Shortland Street, along with several roles in television and theatre.

people.name: Olivia Tennet
people.aboutText:
Mikk Pinnonen (born 4 January 1991) is an Estonian handballer who plays as a playmaker for Știința Municipal Dedeman Bacău in the Romanian Liga Naţională and the Estonian national team.
^ "Mikk Pinnonen: “Un strop de magie”" (in Romanian). stiintahandbal.ro.

people.name: Kris Bryant
people.aboutText:
Kristopher Lee Bryant (born January 4, 1992) is an American professional baseball third baseman for the Chicago Cubs of Major League Baseball (MLB). He attended the University of San Diego, where he played college baseball for the San Diego Toreros baseball team.
Bryant won the Dick Howser Trophy and Golden Spikes Award as the best amateur baseball player in 2013.

people.name: Marlo Mortel
people.aboutText: Marlo Mortel (born on January 4, 1993) is a Filipino actor and singer. He was best known for his role as Nicolo Angelo Cortez in the noontime television drama, Be Careful with My Heart. He is currently under ABS-CBN's talent management Star Magic.

people.name: Martin Paasoja
people.aboutText: Victonara "Ara" Salas Galang is a Filipina volleyball athlete. She is a multi-awarded athlete and is considered as one of the best female volleyball players of the Philippines today. She is a member of the De La Salle University's women's volleyball team in both indoor and beach volleyball.

people.name: Victonara Galang
people.aboutText: Martin Paasoja (born 4 January 1993) is an Estonian professional basketball player who plays as a point guard. He currently plays for Korvpalli Meistriliiga team Rapla.

people.name: Maddie Hasson
people.aboutText: María Isabel López Rodríguez (born 4 January 1995), known professionally as María Isabel, is a Spanish singer who won the Junior Eurovision Song Contest 2004 with the song "Antes Muerta que Sencilla".

people.name: María Isabel
people.aboutText: Madelaine "Maddie" Hasson (born January 4, 1995) is an American actress. She is best known for her role as Willa Monday on the Fox television series The Finder.

people.name: Jade Jones
people.aboutText:
Răzvan Ștefan Popa (born 4 January 1997), is a Romanian footballer who plays as a central midfielder for Internazionale Milano and the Romanian national under-17 team.
He made his Romanian Liga I debut at 15 years and 2 months of age, when he was substituted in the stoppage time on March 17, 2012 against Dinamo București.

people.name: Răzvan Popa
people.aboutText: Jade Jones (born 4 January 1996) is an English wheelchair racer, competing in T54 events. Jones competed in the 2012 Summer Paralympics in the 400m, 800m and 1500m.

people.name: Liza Soberano
people.aboutText: Hope Elizabeth Soberano (born January 4, 1998) is a Filipino-American actress and model. She started in a range of television series and films, including Wansapanataym (2011), Kung Ako'y Iiwan Mo (2012), She's the One (2013), Must Be... Love (2013), and Got to Believe (2013).
